channel.title: Dong Xing's Blog
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Dong Xing's Blog

item.title: 20250922 Senior Varsity Training
item.description: Problem 1 Find the number of integer values of k in the closed interval [-500,500] for which the equation \log(kx)=2\log(x+2) has exactly one real solution.

item.title: 20250915 Senior Varsity Training
item.description: Problem 1 Find the smallest n such that 2013^n ends in 001.

item.title: 20250929 Senior Varsity Training
item.description: Problem 1 Equilateral \triangle ABC with side length 14 is rotated about its center by angle \theta, where 0<\theta<60\degree, to form \triangle DEF.

item.title: Extended Euclidean Algorithm
item.description: The Extended Euclidean Algorithm is an algorithm that finds a pair of integers x and y such that ax+by=\gcd(a,b) for integers a and b in \mathcal{O}(\log(a)+\log(b)) time and \mathcal{O}(\log(a)+\log(b)) space.

item.title: Garden
item.description: 一花一世界，一葉一菩提。 Aug. 25th, 2025 · New York, NY Aug. 26th, 2025 · Cambridge, MA Sept. 6th, 2025 · Princeton, NJ Sept. 8th, 2025 · Princeton, NJ Sept.

item.title: 20251006 Senior Varsity Training
item.description: Problem 1 How many positive integers n are there such that n is a multiple of 5, and the least common multiple of 5! and n equals 5 times the greatest common divisor of 10! and n? Solution Since \begin{align} \operatorname{lcm}(5!,n)=5\gcd(10!,n)&\iff\forall p\in\mathbb{P},\nu_p(\operatorname{lc...

item.title: Welcome to My Blog!
item.description: I am Dong Xing, a sophomore at Princeton International School of Mathematics and Science.

item.title: Competitive Programming Journey
item.description: MIT Informatics Tournament 2025-26 Winter Contest Dec.

item.title: Euclidean Algorithm
item.description: The Euclidean Algorithm is an algorithm that computes \gcd(a, b) for integers a and b in \mathcal{O}(\log(a)+\log(b)) time and \mathcal{O}(\log(a)+\log(b)) space.

item.title: Euler's Sieve
item.description: Euler’s Sieve is an algorithm that finds all the primes in 2,3,\dots,n in \mathcal{O}(n) time and \mathcal{O}(n) space.
